comments.commentBody: "Gioco" is absolutely correct. The DPRK works diligently towards its goals. There should be more than a little concern that they will use these weapons when they can.

The trouble with Obama's approach to North Korea was that it depended on rationality and good judgement.  Thank goodness we now have someone in the White House who can actually out-crazy even Kim Jong-un.  This approach hasn't been tried before.  Probably with good reason.  But still you have to wonder what the reaction will be in the long run should Trump stay in office.
Sorry. I don't actually see any advantage in the ability to "out-crazy Kim Jong-un" --- Especially when the Nuclear Codes are involved.

Well taken, Mr. Bruni.

Let Trump eat what he wants. If his mouth is full, he can't speak. If his fingers are busy conveying food to his mouth, he can't tweet. Besides, it's not important.

Your column reminds me of some mental musings of my own, a few years ago. The topic was Right-Wing Fear of Arugula. I think (as far as my memory goes) that my thoughts were prompted by outrage that Obama ate the stuff. Then I started looking at some of the comments about Obama and other Democrats, and those considered "left," whose patriotism was called into question by their eating habits. Not just arugula, but salad in general. Even when it was based solely on iceberg lettuce. I'm not sure, but I think even cooked vegetables were suspect.

I don't care how Trump wants his steak, any more than I cared whether Pappy Bush liked broccoli.

I don't think we have to focus only on the "big" issues. It is important to know how those who lead our country live their lives, at least insofar as it opens a window onto how they will insist we will live ours.

BTW, I've also served meatloaf at dinner parties. It's a really satisfying dish, and I've been served worse at dinner parties where I have been a guest. The only problem is that, if I do serve meatloaf, I should remember to buy some catsup for those who might want it.

This summer a woman actually accused another shopper in a supermarket for being a Clinton supporter because she had low-fat yogurt and fresh greens in her shopping cart, and kept hounding her and following her around because the other woman refused to answer.
So, that's right, Mr. Bruni some people can be food anti-snobs and nasty as well.

@CL: I doubt that story -- did you see it with YOUR OWN eyes? or was it something "you read on social media"?

If someone follows you and hounds you in a supermarket...A. they are insane and B. you should call first the manager...then the police!

That is very abnormal behavior and has nothing to do with politics.

I voted for Trump, and I assure you that I buy yogurt and fresh salad greens ALL THE TIME. And nobody has ever said a word to me about it!

prevent other nations to become threats to their neighbors and the world.

Such is the view of Pakistan, China, India, France, Israel and all holders of nuclear weapons and those striving to achieve parity with them. Each in order to protect THEIR OWN interests.

North Korea is China's "trump" card and so it will remain. Why would they give it up to this US administration? If there is any serious military escalation in the South China Sea or wherever, China need only greenlight and backstop a North Korean assault across the 38th parallel and things will quickly get way too complicated for this president to handle.

It's highly unlikely that Hillary would do half the inane things Trump has done so far, in spite of the Republican spin against her...And you definitely wouldn't see her cozying up to Vladimir Putin or the Russians
I don't consider it a rush to judgement to point out the obvious:  No one in this WH is equipped to deal coherently and intelligently with any of this.

Andre

In the fail to realize department,

The US is not the cause of Chinese invasions of (north) Vietnam, "moral support" (!) or not.

Unless China is our imperial puppet. me, I think China pursues its interests according to its current dictators' iffy grasp of those interests.

Does the blame America but give no credit thingie so popular on the apology tour have a limit? I have yet to see it. Trump enablers all.

The PRC has cut off tourism to South Korea and halted the influx of Korean entertainment to China, as punishment, because of the deployment of the THAAD anti-missile system in South Korea.
The leadership in China is likely going to help make war a reality before they actually get around to doing something about the DPRK – their sponsored poster child for war.

Noth Korea has an untrustworthy, conniving, murderous and unscrupulous leader who drives sane persons crazy to see how he may be appeased or neutralized. Iran has an equally admirable and equally trustworthy leader who also keeps sane people from restful sleep. The US could not let itself slide so far behind on the Mutually Assured Delusion scale. We now have our own unspeakably unpredictable, untrustworthy and unscrupulous leader who's undoubtedly keeping North Korean and Iran leaders awake and worried sick at night. Maybe this is what it takes to scare the pants off them, decency and predictability have not worked.
Duck and cover...once again...
How convenient that the Times "found" this hidden gem less than two month after Trump became president after it was hidden so long!

It is often the case twwren that fact and reality based news takes a while to investigate and put all the pieces together.  It doesn't just rely on making up some fantastic claim that fits into a Tweet and then sending it out based on a momentary impulse.

Actually, there's nothing "hidden" about this story.
North Korea has been a troublesome spot on the map for decades -- the only thing new is the increasing stretch of its ICBMs.

The only problem with that argument is its implication that we don't yet face a significant threat from N Korea. This is in light of the fact that 2-3 nuclear devices launched from container ships offshore and detonated 1-200 miles above the US would send us directly back to the 1800's albeit with none of the skills and systems in place to feed and care for ourselves.
An EMP attack could be launched anonymously and without the need for intercontinental carriers. The first thing you would notice is the lights going out all over the US. THe second thing would be the lack of water and then the stores would run out of food.
How many days can we go hungry before chaos ensues?!
This is way too logical. We need to keep the focus on Meryl Streep.
China took out one of it's own satellites to demonstrate the feasibility of what they can do. I don't think they would sit idly by if we take military action.
Two people who are definitely bonkers have bunkers. Good analogy there.
Yes, you go ahead, Donny boy.  Try to make President Obama look bad.  Dig your grave a little deeper with the Good People of America who will see you unseated very soon.

“I like Trump, he’s a brilliant man."

That comment left me slack jawed. Trumpy may be the least intellectually-gifted and most intellectually dishonest president we've had in generations, and I'm including "W."

That people can have such disparate views of the same person astounds me. It is as if these folks were talking about a completely different person.
I think a lot of people don't know the difference between intelligence and cunning.  He certainly is cunning.
It is all in the perspective of the person.  For eight years, all I heard from my conservative neighbors out here was a constant drumbeat about how a black man was ruining America.
Perhaps they are quoting what Fox et al quoted Putin as saying - though it turns out that was a mistranslation, and Putin really said Trump was a "colorful" person.

The most staggering two facts about this article are that:

1. it could be written without NYT access to TS/SCI information from multiple sources who are illegally providing it, and
2. that former President Obama did not properly send instructions to his entire intel structure to resecure all this information instead of apparently allowing them the tacit OK to release it for public distribution through the New York Times (and, heaven forbid, to other media as well).

We are indeed at risk if not from the nuclear reality, from the very fact that such information has even been written for public distribution, and if true, it is much more than a mere indictment of the ability of the trusted political hacks who apparently have the highest clearances to undermine the US government for purely political purposes.

I am fully confident however, that President Trump will do what is necessary to purge the entire ranks of these traitors who provided such information for public distribution. On that much we can rest assured.

If there has ever been a reason to drain the swamp, this is it.

Thank you NYT for providing a really good reason to take prompt action against traitors.

Amazing that someone would read an article like this and walk away dwelling on phantoms and conspiracies bubbling up within the U.S. government.  Even Kim Jung-un would be envious of the blind devotion of Trump's followers.

Mi.T.,
Exactly HOW many people worth over a hundred million bucks - and earned it themselves - are either stupid or crazy?
You define yourself as hopelessly gullible to hear a thin-skinned man pop back at his attackers and see it as either condition.
Your side's utterly corrupted candidate LOST. It is time to moce on.

I suggest you ditch the bloggers and stick to a different set of sources for news.
comments.userLocation: Fair Verona where we lay our scene

comments.commentBody: @L’Osservatore. I wouldn’t tout Trump’s business skills as some claim to presidential potential. He seems utterly ignorant about trade, immigration, terrorism, intelligence, the military, and foreign policy. He’s smart enough to read a rabid, misinformed crowd, distill their venom, and and spew it right back. And, if I were looking for a tax dodging, migrant labor exploiting, bad credit risk, self promoting loudmouth, he’d be my guy. Otherwise, I wouldn’t touch him with a ten foot pole, let alone have him in the White House.

I am totally shocked that Donald Trump eats poorly. Really. Does he at least insist on organic Heinz? Had the cow who is now the steak been grass-fed---grass feeding matters to those who eat meat and feel really really bad about eating meat that the cow lived a good or at least less bloated and gassy life? I like Bruni. I think he's charming, smart, thoughtful. And I agree: on food, who cares? President Trump will probably not shock us all and ask us to consider the lobster or the cow or the pig or the chicken or any living, breathing non-human animal's welfare. Our president eats such terrible food in such a terrible way and that we---indeed, right now, I should be reading my students' essays and finishing Americanah---expend so much effort deriding such silliness speaks loudly about how normalizing the president, what so many of us feared would happen, is inevitable. Great.

Anyone who feels really, really, really badly about eating meat should not do so. It will come as a surprise to you that most cattle are not fitness buffs and and are no more concerned about the contents of their food than the average Big Mac consumer is. If you feel badly about eating meat-it is likely because you think it is wrong to kill sentient beings by bopping them on the noggin, just because they taste good. At the concentration camps, they had prisoner orchestras playing as people were slaughtered. I guess that made it ok?
Personally, I eat meat that I like-had some tonight. Someday, it will be my turn. This is life. Do not overthink it. In my opinion.

I don't know where this presidential stuff comes from. All you had to do was watch his facial expressions. He would make a statement and have this smug look that said I know I'm right, no argument.

He made some pie in the sky stories up, as to how his plans will put millions to work, how sending all those immigrants back will save $billions, and that those coal mines will be flourishing again. He will stop other countries from taking advantage of us by making things we want to buy cheaper than they can be made here.

He projected an isolationist U.S. which is supposed to make us richer. these are obvious appeals to a core of voters who believe this garbage. These are the core of the flyover states that consider themselves economics experts after they read an editorial in the local paper, or heard Rush explain another conspiracy theory. They believe, they go to rallies, jump up and down and shout "I believe" a few times.

I have heard many presidential speeches, this was just plain garbage, but good at the fourth grade level. Well Mr. Ms, and Mrs. true believers, do not come to my door asking for those spare cans of soup. When your SS goes the way of a mortgage on a Trump hotel, and you can not get that hernia fixed so you can go to work, just remember, it is what what you wanted.

You have become another Trump creditor, and he has a record of reneging on his debts. You have better odds with a one armed bandit, instead of a two faced one.

Should be pointed out Trump's war on much of what America stands for--directing the destruction of the ACA and putting in place a $1 Trillion tax on Americans through policies that threaten and insult other countries, targeting our #3 trader, Mexico, and through an expanded plan -- criminalize undocumented workers and other immigrants of color and deport them without due process. Other Trump tantrums include:
* Repealed the background gun purchase check rule that screened out people receiving special Social Security benefits because mental problems made it impossible for them to work or even manage their own money.
* Repealed regulation prohibiting coal companies from dumping their waste into streams.
* Signed a bill repealing a rule that publicly traded oil, gas and mining companies had to disclose payments they make to foreign governments and levels of methane gas pollution.
* Rescinded the Parole in Place program, a special program for non-citizen immediate family members of active U.S. military personnel and veterans to apply for a US green card, without having to leave the country.

David Underwood - Citrus Heights
You characterize the recent presidential speech as one of, ".....speeches at the 4th grade level".
Well, that's the developmental level in which Mr. Trump lives.
We would like to expect more but I don't think it's possible with this particular person.

Although I agree with your position, as a fly over state resident, I have to say I'm a little tired of broad insults. After seeing a disturbing number of Trump signs last fall in western MA. and currently in northern CA, to change the situation we need all like minded people to join together to fight the scourge. So, please, enough already.

Okay. I will allow 45's welldone steak with ketchup without complaint. I agree, what one finds as gustatory comforts varies widely. However one thing I of which I am fearful, is the time our leader is expected to travel and to dine with foreign dignitaries and heads of state. Will Donald be "happy having what they are having", will he balk and push whatever he has around his plate uneaten? Or will he bring along a galley servant well stocked with fried chicken and taco bowls no matter where he is in the world? Social etiquette demands a bit of an adventurous palate, and I have seen little evidence of that from the Donald. A creature of habit with navy blue suits, frequent hand washing, I see little hope of him blending in anywhere. Trying new things is not his strong suit.
The president does not always eat the food prepared at foreign dinners, his food is sourced and prepared separately. You don't have to worry about that.
Perhaps he will eat what is put in front him, only to push himself away from the table to vomit in his lap as did Bush 41.

Trump sent one his sons to handle a deal in China because he literally did not want to eat the food there. Imagine that! A guy from Queens, living in NYC his enter life, but won't eat Chinese food. What kind of New Yorker is he anyway?

In other fake news, this friend and soulmate of Roy Cohn will next claim that he was abducted by space aliens, and that's why his tweets are so out-of-this-world crazy.

If there are really space aliens out there, and the monitor this newspaper, take our crazy, evil President, please!

Difficult but not impossible. My gimmes were GASLIGHT (my mother wouldn't let us watch it when young because it was too scary), EUREKA, NOBELIST and YPRES. Never heard of OPSIMATH. LEMONPEEL was annoying.
Actually the wiretapping is real. You can find records of the FISA requests on google.
